data.title: Highly Indifferent
data.text: One visit to this establishment will suffice!  We ordered lunch from the daily special menu - chicken fried steak with 2 sides and bread.  The breading on the steak had a faint stale grease taste.  The gravy was thin and had a strong bacon flavor.  Green beans had no flavor at all and the texture of the mashed potatoes screamed "instant!"  The rolls were beautiful and fluffy - and dry and tasteless, served without butter.  Check out took forever and the cash register line croses the path of the servers, so you stand and stand, right in the way. The quantity was more than adequate, and considering the quality, much of mine remained on the plate.

data.title: Poor service and overpriced
data.text: The only reason people go here's me and go to look at the girls in short shorts and skimpy tops. Food is fair at best. Service is very very slow. Getting refills on drinks is impossible. Do yourself a favor and skip this place!

data.title: Traditional eatery
data.text: Standard/traditional eating place in downtown Garland. Casual atmosphere for breakfast and lunch. Good breakfast selections including some traditional Mexican breakfast items. Locals like to eat here and lots of city officials and other community leaders frequent this historical restaurant.

data.title: Best breakfast spot
data.text: Love both locations, I normally visit the Rowlett location more. But both places are very consistent and love lots of their options! Always busy but we try to order quick. You can enjoy the coffee refills while you wait! Such better quality and taste than going to a chain for breakfast!

data.title: Hubbard's Cubbard
data.text: Hubbards serves breakfast all day, home cooking, hamburgers, salads, homemade cakes and pies.  It is a good family place to go.

data.title: Surpringly Good Food and Value - with Great Scenary as Well!
data.text:
This old restaurant near downtown Garland, Texas has been around for years. I understand they also have one in Rowlett but I have not tried it.

The breakfast are huge and very reasonable!  $8.50 will get you enough food to stuff two adults! Come hungry!  And they mix the normal eggs of your choice with refried beans and rice, a great tamale, and bread or  tortillas.  Just a standard (huge) Texas breakfast.  Lunch is good also but what a steal for breakfast.

It is true that on weekends, they get busy and you may have to wait so coming early is a good idea.  But good food, old time atmosphere, pretty faces and good value -- what else do you need to say?

The wait staff is a collection of beautiful young women, maybe 20-25, with a great service attitude and a big smile on their faces.  As a guy, I do not know whether to stare or smile or just be glad that old fashion customer service (with a pretty face) is here to great you!  Special requests do not fluster them so that is also a plus.

data.title: Sunday Brunch
data.text:
We had eaten at the other Hubbard's in Rowlett, Texas but had never tried this location before .  This location also has eclectic decor and a friendly atmosphere. We were told to find a seat anywhere we wanted and within 2 minutes we each had a cup of coffee and a menu.  I had the Texas Chili & Cheese Omelet with pan fries and biscuits & gravy.
My wife had the short stack of blueberry pancakes and 2 eggs over easy with sausage patties. Everything was very good.  The servers were friendly and courteous, the restaurant was clean, and the coffee cup never got under half full.

data.title: Popular breakfast spot
data.text: This is a down to earth diner and it's always packed on weekend mornings so come early. I've never had anything I didn't like here and the prices are pretty typical. They serve a decent lunch also but I prefer their breakfast food. Pancakes are huge.

data.title: Fantastic place to eat!!
data.text: The employees there are very friendly and make you feel like a valued customer.  I love the food there!!  They have some great home made pies!!

data.title: Servers are nice to look at Food is typical cafe food
data.text: Servers are nice to look at Food is typical cafe food. I was there for breakfast a few times. They have these young girls that serve the food. The food is done in a dinner style portions are ok.

data.title: Cafe Food
data.text: Typical city cafe food.  Don't come here for health food!  Great menu, friendly staff that is also very easy on the eyes!!!!  Cute, young waitresses!  Great breakfast spot!

data.title: This restaurant has been here forever - and that is a good thing!
data.text: Located at the outskirts of downtown, this café has been at the corner of 9th Street and Main for years.  The food is pretty basic but good. Breakfast has the standards and my favorite, a full Mexican breakfast for about $8.50. The food is very good but the best part of the cafe is the waitresses. they are cheerful, young, helpful and very pretty. A smile from them is a great way to start the day!  Their lunches are good as well and close to the same price. It is popular so do not be surprised to wait for a seat. But they clean the tables quickly and I have never waited more then 15-20 minutes.

data.title: Good breakfast diner
data.text:
This is a good breakfast stop.  Nice variety of options and breakfast all day.  Huevos Rancheros is very good.  Bacon is thick and crispy.  I've read some reviews that it is expensive but it is less than the chains like IHOP and Denny's.

Service started really well and I was pleased they had decaf ready.  But after the first refill they never offered more coffee.

data.title: This is the GO-TO breakfast and down home place in Garland
data.text: Hubbard's does breakfast well. They are an institution in Garland. This location is very close to Dos Banderas Mexican Restaurant.

data.title: Iconic Tex-Tex cooking done to perfection, served by a bevy of pretty girls. What could go wrong?
data.text: Good food served by pretty girls (mostly drawn from the nearby Garland High School) at good prices. There are Tex-Tex and Tex-Mex menu selections that are extremely authentic. I suggest the Tex-Tex selections for those adverse to spicy heat (nobody ever burned their nose hairs with a short stack of pancakes), but in all the years I ate there I have never gotten a bad meal.

data.title: Back to the 50s
data.text: This place is astonishingly retro.  The atmosphere is terrific and the menu covers the entire spectrum of down home meals.  Want something?  Raise your hand.  The staff is eager to please.  It has become my go-to place for brunch/late lunch.  Delicious budget-friendly meals at an affordable price.  Can't be beat!

data.title: Sunday Lunch
data.text: We love Hubbard's Cubbard !  We often come here after church on Sunday and have breakfast for lunch.  The omelet's are awesome.  I always take half of mine home.  They are just too big for one meal.  Served with delish hash browns, biscuits and gravy. Yum !  Hubby gets a waffle with sausage and bacon.  Plus, the only way I give a stamp of approval is by the smoothness of the iced tea and HC serves smooth iced tea!!

data.title: Standard Texas smalltown cafe.
data.text: Pretty good food, very fast service, very easy-to-look-at Servers!! Breakfasts are the best.  Very limited parking, but worth the trouble!

data.title: Best Southern breakfast!
data.text: I love this place for breakfast.  All the comfort foods I love, bacon, biscuits, grits!  Probably not great for a diet but you have to let loose and enjoy sometimes.  And the pies!  LOVE the pies!

data.title: Comfort food.
data.text: Hubbard's is a no frills restaurant that cooks down home style food.  It's a great place for Sunday morning brunch, meeting with friends for lunch, and just a fun place to grab a quick bite to eat.  Like I said, it's nothing fancy, just down home cooking.
